reviews.sentence: Nice uptown hotel. We stayed there for 5 nights at the end of June and the beginning of July. We are SPG members so were got an 830 am check in. They also provided use in 2 bottles free water free wifi and a room on the 13th floor in the tower overlooking downtown Toronto. We were with family members who are not SPG members so they did not get the free water in the room free wifi or a room in the tower building. There are apples and flavoured water in the lobby. There is free filtered drinking water in the gym so fill up your water bottles. Across the street there are fast food restaurants and a korean supermarket. To the west there is a Longos supermarket banks Shoppers drug market and fast food restaurants. We had one slight confusion with the green option with regards to housekeeping. When we were there hotel renovations were occurring between the lobby and the japanese restaurant katsura. These renovations did not effect our stay in anyway. I enjoyed the pool very much even though it was crowded. The pool was clean and warm enough for my swim workouts. The hot tub was clean and the temperature was set. 100 degrees F. The only problem was the pool kiosk was always low on towels so go to the gym which is next door and use the smaller gym towels. The bedroom and bathroom are what you expect on a spg dedicated floor. We only had banquet food at the hotel which was surprisingly good. Overall a nice place to stay with friendly service if your events are uptown. but if you are first time Toronto tourist and want to go downtown you may want to choose another Westin closer to downtown.

Third visit only confirms our previous impression of profesonal and classy hotel with beautiful landscaped surroundings. This was our third visit to the Westin Prince and like our previous visits we were impressed by the professional and friendly service our upgraded room and the beautiful lush landscape that provided opportunities for strolling in woods meditating or just sitting in lawn chairs overlooking the ravine below. In addition there was a large pool dry sauna jacuzi tennis court and gym. It resembled a spa retreat in a sense. In addition we really like the abundant choice of restaurants across the street in a series of strip shopping centers which are literally side by side with varying quality food opportunities much like Toronto itself. I would recommend the Pho establishment and the Spoon and Fork buffet personally. The Westin Prince is an ideal place for a vacation as the ambiance is relaxed professional and spa like. As well there is a large park system just south of the hotel that by itself is beautiful in addition to being part of the Lower Don bikeway a bike trail that leads all the way to downtown Toronto and the waterfront. The hotel is also located very near the Don Valley Parkway which is usually a quick drive downtown of maybe 20 minutes in non rush hour traffic. We both appreciated our experience at your hotel and wish to thank all the staff.

Good stay. Our view had a room of downtown Toronto. The workout room was great. The lobby was trendy. Our room was clean. There were restaurants right across the street that we walked to for dinner. It took us about 20 minutes to get downtown without traffic.

awesome pool and fitness facilities. awesome hotel. great pool and fitness facility. They waived the fee for wi fi. in this day and age you would think that would be free anyway. great rooms very large and bright. pool and size of room close to public transit so you can get anywhere you want to go without the issue of finding public parking free wi fi. they charge for it but they waived the fee.

Good location to highways and attractions. For the one night was ok. Room view nice overlooking wooded area and tennis courts. Quick checking in and checkout no difficulties. All staff throughout the facility were pleasant. Staff pleasant Japanese restaurant next door entertaining. Science Centre Downtown Toronto Greek Village Patio doors in room very very difficult to open. Dirty exhaust fan in bathroom pieces of dust fell when in using the room. Whirlpool dirty.

Great hotel with great staff. I went there with my fiancé for a 3 day stay and it was a nice hotel with a great view looking towards the CN tower in the distance. There is a beautiful outdoor pool with lots of chairs and an indoor hot tub and sauna. There are fruit trees in the front of the hotel and many great restaurants on the other side of the road. If you do not like driving in Toronto there is a bus stop in front of the hotel and buses come every 10 minutes. The bus takes about 10 minutes to get to the subway and there is a free transfer. The staff were all very friendly and eager to help in any way. We are definitely looking forward to going back there.

Excellent. Thanks to this hotel for making my business trip super comfortable. Easy checkin and also received an upgrade to the penthouse level. Clean modern hotel with restaurants and bar on site. Hotel has a clean modern well equipped gym to destress. I will stay here again.

Exceptional Service. I can not say enough good things about the service at the Westin Prince in North York ONThe welcoming experience begins with the lovely valet gents who make every effort to get to know your routine offer you a warm hello each morning. The front desk staff know me by name always have my room points taken care of including my go green option. They truly appreciate your business loyalty feels rewarded. This location has a great workout facility as well and nice grounds for walking when the weather cooperates.

Great stay cation for the family. We live in Toronto and our 10 year old wanted to have her birthday party at a hotel. We were there with 2 other 10 year old girls and the place suited our needs perfectly. there is a nice large outdoor pool tennis courts table tennis hot tub and lots of places to eat nearby as well as the hotel of course. The grounds are nice and our room was very spacious. The staff was very very friendly.

Nice location. The location was fine for the things we wanted to do. The room was dark and was almost impossible to find a place to put make up on. Interesting bathroom as they had a little area that could be used for dressing and applying make up. There were no electrical outlets in this area and it was about 120 degrees as the air conditioning never reached it. It was always hot and uncomfortable. There was a mirror in the larger area of the room but the lighting was so bad and the fact there was no electrical outlet nearby made it hard to use for anything. When we checked in it was obvious there were 3 of us 2 adults and 1 teenager. When she checked the room she said it was 2 double beds and asked if we would prefer a King bed. I asked if there was a sleeper sofa in the room and she said no. Okay so you are looking at us and we are three adults basically and you are offering a room with ONE King bed. really. The room was huge and had plenty of room for 2 King beds. The double beds were NOT comfortable and one of them made so much noise when you turned over that it woke everyone else up. The air conditioning was super loud and kept us up or woke us up when it clicked on or off. The restaurant was okay but terribly over priced for what was served. The parking is over priced as well. The parking was also an issue. We decided to park our car at our familys and they dropped us off at the hotel. When asked about parking we thought about it and then said no thank you. However they charged us for it anyway. I am glad I looked at the invoice. Then when they said they would take it off the bill they could not give me another receipt showing it had been removed. Really. Checked my bank today and they have NOT removed the charge. The only thing that was positive about the hotel was that it was at least somewhat close to all our activities. When we return to Toronto we probably will not stay here again.
Good. The restaurant was very good. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The fitness facility was ok but not great. It could do with an update.

Great Customer Service Overcomes All. Stayed at the property as part of conference. Even though I arrived long before check in time the front desk staff got me a room. Room service was swift although typical hotel overpriced. My lunch arrived within 20 minutes of order and the food was hot and plentiful. On the 2nd day of my stay discovered that i could not receive any incoming calls. My maintenance man Mani was quick to diagnose that one of the phone lines had been cut by the group doing street repairs. MANI was extremely apologetic and offered to have my room moved. When I told him that this was unnecessary since I only had night left he promised some sort of compensation for my inconvenience. later in the day Mani showed up with a comp breakfast certificate and later the manager Krisandrasent me a handwritten note and chocolates. further apologizing. Problems aside this is a great hotel with great food and service. I highly recommend.
Location. No heated swiming pool and jacuzi tub under repair. Gym is kinda small for that big hotel.

Clean comfortable hotel good location. Very comfortable hotel staff were great. Room was good sized and well equipped. Buffet breakfast had lots of variety and everything appeared to be quite fresh and tasty. Only downsize was the quite pathetic gym very small only a few treadmills two stationary cycles and a few weight machines. No bigger than a home gym not in any way suitable for a major hotel with business travellers and active tourists. Gym needs to be totally overhauled small poorly equipped and crowded.

Convenient location unprofessional staff overcharging. The location was convenient for my trip. The staff behaved unprofesionaly. The hotel has a broken relationship with bokingcom which resulted in undue stress and overcharging my account. The staff refused to drop the overcharges telling me to deal with my booking agent bokingcom. They also charged my credit card for one extra night without notifying me. I only found it out by examining my credit card statement. The rooms and amenities pool sauna and jacuzi are outdated and grim.

Nice stay at the Westin Prince. Stayed here during a family trip to Toronto. Front desk staff was friendly hotel was very clean and they pump a very nice fragrance in the lobby which gives you a nice relaxing feeling when you enter the building. The room was big so I wish that there was a couch or additional seating in the room as opposed to a single leather chair. Bathroom was clean and functional. The outdoor pool was very big and a great temperature. The hot tub was also really nice. The sauna was not hot enough. We did not use the gym but it looked like it had good equipment. Parking was very convenient and the hotel location was pretty central to everything. The main restaurant Seasons was great for both dinner and the buffet breakfast. Pricy but great quality. Would stay here again.
Exceptional. No tv in the fitness room. And the tv did not work on my exercise bike. But the room staff and restaurant were excellent.
Very average. Disappointing gym for a 4 star. I have stayed at better Four Points locations.

When I arrived at 5 pm none of the three rooms were available. I had to wait 30mins for one room to become available and another 2 hours for the other two rooms. One of the rooms have kids toys women underwear a broken shower door and trash in the room. The staff was not friendly and rude at times. The breakfast was overpriced and the food was not cooked completely eggs and sausages. The hot tube and sauna were both broken. For the price I paid for the three rooms I should have had better service and upgrades. The service and experience was equivalent to service I expect at a motel 6.

Went for my birthday first time back to Toronto in 15 years Other than location this place is not a recommended stay if you are use to the Westin experience after staying in over 50 Westin locations globally. This is by far the worstCustomer service horrible room service food average make sure you read the fine print at this hotel. Spa did n’t work pool dirty gym dirty. AC unit smelled of cigarettes weed even though it was smokeless hotel. We decided stay out of the hotel most of the time and dreaded coming back just to sleep.
